description:
Methods are like functions, but different. How? Why? And what's will
having to type "self" all the time?

We'll explore partial application of functions and review why it might
be nice to start using classes. Then to clarify how method objects work
we'll examine the result of accessing the method attributes of an object
without calling them. Understanding the behavior we uncover here will
require more attribute lookup experiments, which will lead us discover
the power of descriptors.

Along the way we'll peek in at other languages' approaches to method
binding, hopefully coming to appreciate the way Python does things
enough to type "self" a few thousand more times.
title: Know thy self: Methods and method binding
